//-1: Going off the Rule of Nines for body proportions and assuming about 20 ft sq for the whole surface area of the body
//: roughly 0.25mm per sheet of canvas making this a 14-layer jack, sheets are 1x2 feet. 49 sheets for the vest and 18 sheets for the arms (67 total).
//1: human torso is about 7 sq. feet.  76g (canvas) x 14 (layers) x 3.5 (surface area) = 3724g
//2: human arms is about 3 sq. feet.  76g (canvas) x 12 (layers) x 1.5 (surface area) = 1368g
description: A thick cloth jack, intended to be worn below metal armor. This one is made of over a dozen layers of tough canvas, and it provides fairly decent protection on its own.

//: surface area of XL body assumed to be 50% greater and materials used are also 50% greater.
surface area of XL body assumed to be 75% size and materials used are also 75% as much.

//: roughly 0.25mm per sheet of canvas making this 8 layers, sheets are 1x2 feet. 10 sheets total
//1: human head total is about 2.5 sq. feet.  76g (canvas) x 8 (layers) x 1.25 (surface area) = 760g
description: A cloth coif with neck and forehead protection.  Resting on your shoulders, it serves as padding for a helmet.  Though it's pretty warm, it is constructed of tough canvas and provides substantial protection even on its own.

//: surface area of XL body assumed to be 50% greater and materials used are also 50% greater.
surface area of XL body assumed to be 75% size and materials used are also 75% as much.

name.str_pl: pairs of canvas arming gloves

description: Tough gloves made of canvas cloth, thin enough to wear under metal gauntlets.  They help to keep your hands safe during a fight.

//: surface area of XL body assumed to be 50% greater and materials used are also 50% greater.

name.str_pl: pairs of XL canvas arming gloves

//: surface area of XL body assumed to be 75% size and materials used are also 75% as much.

//-1: Going off the Rule of Nines for body proportions and assuming about 20 ft sq in total
//: roughly 0.25mm per sheet of canvas making this a 30-layer jack, sheets are 1x2 feet. 105 sheets for the vest and 36 sheets for the arms (141 total).
//1: human torso is about 7 sq. feet.  76g (canvas) x 30 (layers) x 3.5 (surface area) = 7980g
//2: human arms is about 3 sq. feet.  76g (canvas) x 24 (layers) x 1.5 (surface area) = 2736g
//3: 8 layers thick waist. human waist is about 3ft circumference with the extra padding, and reaches to about below knees. doesn't usually cover the whole circumference so guessing about 1.5x2.5x8 total surface area divided by 1x2 ft for about 15-18 extra sheets, about 1140g if 15 sheets.
description: A thick cloth greatcoat intended to be worn as standalone armor, as it's a little too thick to comfortably add chainmail or a cuirass on top.  Made of thirty layers of tough canvas, this will protect you from almost everything, but it's very heavy and warm.  The sleeves are a bit thinner for flexibility and it drapes below your legs, providing additional protection there.

//: surface area of XL body assumed to be 50% greater and materials used are also 50% greater.
surface area of XL body assumed to be 75% size and materials used are also 75% as much.

description: A thick cloth surcoat intended to be worn as standalone armor, as it's a little too thick to comfortably add chainmail or a cuirass on top.  Made of thirty layers of tough canvas, this will protect you from almost everything, but it's very heavy and warm.  It drapes below your legs, providing additional protection there, and it lacks sleeves entirely.

name.str_pl: pairs of canvas heavy arming pants

description: Tough, extremely thick cloth pants worn on their own alongside a gambeson.  These are made of a huge number of canvas layers offering very solid protection, though they're too thick to easily add metal armor on top and are both stuffy and restrictive.

//: surface area of XL body assumed to be 50% greater and materials used are also 50% greater.

name.str_pl: pairs of XL canvas heavy arming pants

//: surface area of XL body assumed to be 75% size and materials used are also 75% as much.

/1: human hands assumed to be about 1 sq ft total, 76g (canvas) x 8 (layers) x 0.5 (surface area) = 304g
/2: on top of that, additional 2x as thick layer on about 60% of the hand, so adding another 5 sheets for 9 total (684 g)

name.str_pl: pairs of canvas heavy arming mittens

description: Very thick canvas gauntlets worn in lieu of metal or leather armor.  Though they make it hard to do anything other than swing a weapon, and they're very warm, they offer excellent protection.
